text: Backlog z Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Troszkę wychodzi alko w smaku. Wciąż - zabójczo pijalne i smaczne.
Sample at MBCC 2017. Fruity and hoppy smell. Similar taste with citrus and grapefruit. Im surprised to see this was a session IPA as I wrote down boozy and strong bitterness on this beer.
At the source: hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is tropical fruits and citrus. Taste is slightly bitter. Nice level of sweetness at just the right level. Some aftertaste. Nice.

Draft at Ginger Man. Murky yellowish color with a thick, frothy foam of white head that sticks around for a while. Clean, fruity hop aroma. Lots of resin, pine, and cattiness. Dry, hoppy flavor, pithy and clean. Drinks great. Smooth, clean, dry. Not at all watery or thin. Really good.
Draft at OH. Lots of grassy, green, pithy, dry hop taste. Lots of action on the palate. Very hopped up for a session IPA. Sweet, fairly complex aroma. Good.

Tap into a shot glass showing lightly filtered apricot yellow with a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose is subtle and barely any aroma upon pouring, needs time to warm up. Upon warming up light notes of grapefruit and cannabis begin to show. But my score stands due to the subtly. 

The palate is moderately carbonated and light bodied. Flavors of dry pineapple and cannabis with a light bitterness and a barely perceivable malt note on the linger.

Hazy golden color with a medium sized white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, floral hops, tropical fruits, toasted malts. Taste of grapefruit, pine, citrus, tropical fruits, resiny hop finish.

Can, 1 pint. Clearish golden with a minimal head. Aromas of floral hops, caramel, honey, resin. Medium to light bodied, fizzy carbonation. Medium sweet, medium to light bitter. Stinging herbal and hoppy character into a fizzy finish.

Can, 1 pint. A clear golden beer with a small white head. Aroma is of flowers, citrics and resin. Taste is bitter with moderate sweetness. Medium bodied with faint carbonation and astringency. Floral finish with a bitter aftertaste.

rom notes. This one was enjoyed at Traviss house during a planned two-man IPA rampage on July 5. 16 oz can. The pour is a foggy golden yellow color with a large white head that falls down to a film, leaving a good bit of lace. The aroma is dank as fuck. There is a ton of citrus zest. Hoppy pine and zest. I love it. The flavor is just like it smells. This is incredible for a session. There is a lot more grain picked up in the taste, but its really well balanced. There is a nice juiciness that makes its way in and that decently large hop dankness. The mouth feel is light and crisp, with a softer carbonation and a lingeringly dank pine resin finish. This was surprisingly good.
Can thanks to maxdaddy. Color is straw yellow. Hop cone and yeasty eaters on the nose. Stone fruit sugars and tart apple. Finishes dry with some light carbonation. Great mouthfeel and damn tasty.
Light yellow body, medium haze, soapy white cap with a touch of lacing. Lovely aroma of melon, pineapple. Fresh hop character with medium bitterness. Citrus rind. Light in body. Quaffable.
16oz can thanks to Davey Cockette for the hook up! Pours a hazy orange color with a small semi fizzy white head. Aroma and taste of citrus zest, cat piss, chives, pineapple, and bready malts.

Can. Pours hazy golden with off-white head. Aroma is citrus grapefruit, lemon and orange. Taste is citrus grapefruit and lemon with a piney grapefruit finish. Very good session IPA. I would drink a lot of it if it were readily available here in CO :)

Fresh can. Nice session IPA with a ton of hop aroma bursting out of the can. I was surprised, though, by how malty the actual beer tasted. Theres a nice grain taste, but I didnt get any overwhelming hop flavor like the nose promised.

Tallboy can via FB hookup. Poured a soft pale super hazed yellow with an ample fluffy bright white head. Aroma of eraser shavings, dry pine needles, dry citrus rind, rotting citrus meat. Flavor is the same plus some bread crusts and grain husks. Good body for a lower ABV beer, medium mouthfeel with strong carbonation.
Can. Light yellow pour with white head. Herbal, floral, grassy hoppy aromas. Flavors are full, grassy, citrus and herbal, even though its light. Fin crushable.

Canned 06/17/16 from recent release. Pours hazy light lemon, sort of gose-colored, with a light white head. Aroma is mango, pineapple, orange citrus, some dank notes, green onion, pine. Flavor is mango, pineapple, grapefruit, orange. Sure, slightly watery, not super full bodied, but then again, its a session. SO, on that note. Well done. Really enjoyable, and super crushable. So cheers to OH for a nice session.

Crowler. Pours clear gold/orange, medium white head, good lacing. Aroma is nice, hay, pine, grass, dank pot, mango. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, juicy, some green tea. Light to Medium body, creamy mouthfeel.

Draught at Rattle & Hum West, NYC. Hazy pale golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Fresh hoppy pine and peach aroma, oranges, mango, grapes, some passion fruit. Hoppy peach flavor, grapes, citrus, hay notes, some pine apples. Great beer.
On tap in taproom. Not much head. Sticky and piney with citrus. Very easy drinking for abv. Really good.
Pretty clear yellow, white. Some light dankness, light melon. Lightly bitter, some bitter malt. Light chewy, body. Short finish. Good.

Growler shared in MA. Pours mostly clear gold with a creamy white head. Great pissy and pithy hops in the nose, lemon rind, pale bread. Light-medium sweet flavor great pithy hop character, peach, nectarine. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Super clean finish, more pith and kiss, melon. Lovely stuff.

Growler @@ Leightons. Gold pour with a small head. Pretty dank and floral. Loss of jasmine, Orange zest. Herb garden. Flavor is nice and dry. Plenty of dried grass. Some sweet nectarine. Jasmine, lemon. Light body, active carb.

Draft at St Gambrinus. It pours lightly hazy gold with a small white head. The nose is soft, juicy, peachy hop, tangerine, pineapple, grass, dankness and a touch of spring onion. The taste is crisp, very bitter, grassy, dank, citrus peel, pineapple chunks and a touch of spice with a lingering bitter - dry finish. Light - medium body and fine carbonation. Bitter, punchy and crushable. Tasty.
sampled at the brewpub pours a hazy orange with a white head. orange and tropical fruit taste

Draught at the brewery. Cloudy orange with very small frothy white head, turning into a ring soon, light floral hops aroma, low carbonation, very well balanced hoppy taste with citrus overtones, long citrus finish. Such a good brew, these guys are hops artists!
UPDATED: JUN 21, 2016 Can-  Pours gold white head - nose and taste of grass, pine, citrus and orange peel and toast - medium body
Draught from the man of ginger. Cloudy gold and some lots of citrus. Power in parcel. Good.

Hazy coloured yellow with a big hop aroma, orange juice, super floral with big juicyness. This is very good and nice, I tend to like the newer New England style hazy IPAs, which OH doesnt always go for - but here theyve and it works wonderfully.

Growler from Broadway Dive, 06/28/2015. Pours bright cloudy orange, hazy white head on top. Aroma of orange pumice, grapefruit, doughy malts, light tropical notes, pine needles. Taste is grapefruit, melon, bready dry malts with lemon, pine finish. Light, juicy body. Lot of flavor packed in, nice.

Draught @ Tørst, Brooklyn, NY
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape and pine. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long citrus, grape and piney finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Draft at Brouwerij Lane. Pours totally cloudy/opaque pale yellow with small head. Aroma is grapefruit juice, orange, dough, light mango, flowers, pine. Nice. Taste is juicier than most in the session IPA category with melon, lime, orange, and pine/herbs. Not too paper and harsh. Solid.

EBF. Pours a hazy golden with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of slight onion, fruits and pine. Taste is moderately bitter and lightly sweet/sugary. Body is medium, carbonation too. Overall a good one, not as good as the Green Diamond though.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2016 Draft at the brewery with Brendan, Andrew, Ellen and streets. Fresh and dank. Sessionable and delicious. Pours a beautiful hazy murky orange body with thin white lacing. Aroma is floral and citrus hop, light bready character and a strange soapy flavor. The soapy character comes out much more on the palate and lingers a bit more than preferred but the other flavors of floral hop, pine and citrus fruits work nicely. Another really solid beer from Other Half. Cheers.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2015 Pours a beautiful bright golden yellow orange, thin white head. Nice big floral & tropical fruit hops up front, thick pine forest, fresh bread, and some super slinky skunky funky hop nonsense. Flavor is bready pale malt, bitter citrus peel & floral hop, fresh lemon zest. This thing is packed with hops but so fresh, clean and drinkable... Small green everything indeed. Crushed it. Top of the session ladder.  Batch 2 (2015) > Batch 1 (2014)... By a wide margin.
